events.name: Pixels, Graphic and Animation
events.description: ======================== Registration Details (at Xerox Building) ========================= Registration starts from 5.45pm, please proceed immediately to level 1, Fuji Xerox Tower at Anson Road (Tanjong Pagar). This session will start at 6.00pm. ========================= Meeting Topics ========================= Session 1 Adobe Edge Animate with James Lee  5 Reasons to use Adobe Edge Animate Adobe Edge Animate has been touted as a replacement for Adobe Flash. Is it true?  Indeed, Edge Animate is a powerful, intuitive software tool that enables you to create interactive animations for the web, iBooks, and apps. Join me in this session and I will share 5 great reasons why you should start using Adobe Edge Animate. Session 2 Adobe Photoshop CC with Leon Lim  Tips, tricks and hidden secrets in Photoshop CC With more than 15 years of using Adobe Photoshop, Leon Lim will share some of the simple tip, tricks and hidden secrets that he has found and used over the years. This session is for both newbies as well as long time users of the software. Session 3 Adobe InDesign CC with Mark Plunkett  Build Animated GIFs in Photoshop Animated GIF format has been around for many years and you may have seen them in many websites and social media. In this session, we will like to show you how simple it is to create an animated GIF using Photoshop. After this session, you can create fun and interactive banners, icons, logos and images. ========================= Agenda ========================= 5.45pm - 6.15pm Session 1: James Lee 6.15pm - 6.35pm Session 2: Leon Lim 6.35pm - 6.45pm Short break & Refreshments 6.45pm - 7.15pm Session 3: Mark Plunkett  ========================= Refreshments ========================= Hot beverages, water and snacks will be provided during the meeting with compliments from Fuji Xerox Singapore. ========================= Facebook ========================= http://www.facebook.com/groups/idugsg/ ========================= Twitter ========================= @InDesignSG ========================= Sponsors ========================= This meeting has been made possible with the generous support of Adobe, Fuji Xerox Singapore, ACE Training, Touch & Print and Dexel.
events.location: Fuji Xerox Singapore, 80 Anson Road, Fuji Xerox Towers, S(079907)
events.group_name: Singapore Graphic Design and Publishing Group

events.name: JS Beginner Study Group
events.description:
- The purpose of this study group is for learning JS at your own pace, by working through resources, sharing and discussion - We do not host any talks or courses Bring in any material or questions that you might like to go through with the group. If you would like to work on your own practical projects or online resources, feel free to do so. **DON'T FORGET to bring your laptops!! <3<3<3 **Join our #milo-dinosaur chat channel: http://kopijs.herokuapp.com/ 


**Please note: As we have talk.js on 17 September and Hari Raya Haji on 24 September, we will be postponing our next study session to 1 October after this one.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Gazelle Twin and Special Guests
10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
FREE

This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents.

 Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin.  Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”.

Joining Gazelle Twin is Singapore based Japanese artist Yuzuru Maeda, who will perform pieces from her Zentai Art Project including ‘UFO concert’, a work which asks the question ‘what if we were the only one in the universe?’. The performance will explore dynamic temperature change, climate change, disasters, and extremes in economy and political conflicts, and where the connection between technology and nature can allow us to feel less alone. Together with CIRCUITRIP + NZSDLX, the music starts in a collection of the voices, ending with the music generated by a handmade circuit-bending plastic bra.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: Sep/2015 - Open Space (Motivation)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Marcelo Cosas Open Space Theme: Motivation  Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and pizza 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology.  Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT). Building Access The building requires someone from Barclays to allow people into the lift and to the room. Someone from Barclays will be at the reception area to help you enter the building. The timings he/she will make the trip are: 7:00pm, 7:15pm and 7:30pm There is no guarantee of trips after 7:45pm.
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.description: Hey everyone, Thanks for joining the ReactJS meetup. Since this is our first session, we'll be covering the basics of React. We'll also be using this session to gauge the overall skill level and identify areas of interest to tailor subsequent meetups. ======================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Intro to React (Ken Tan) #2 - Testing React with Jest (Sheng Hau) #3 - Project sharing (everyone is welcome to briefly talk about what they're using/planning to use React for) ======================================== Wanna share at one of our meetups? Just contact any of us below:• Sheng Hau (chaishenghau@gmail.com)• Wendy (sohwendy@gmail.com)• Raphael (raphaeltanyw@gmail.com)• Yun Long (chong.yunlong@gmail.com)

If you have something you'd like to share, please contact Valentine and/or Ishan!) Venue and drinks sponsor: ThoughtWorksFood sponsor: IBM Bluemix(Thanks guys!)

events.name: 16 September: On Trails Through Jungles and Poetry
events.description:
This September, we welcome two groups of speakers with great love for the nature in Singapore. 

Do you know that Singapore still retains some primary rainforest? Our friends, the volunteers from the Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum (yes, the one with the dinosaurs and the whale) will be sharing about some of the amazing biodiversity that we have in our backyard, and on the threats that  nature faces. 

We also welcome the team behind From Woodlands to Walden, an interfaith anthology of writing about nature in Singapore. The book explores the relationship we have with our environment, providing the opportunity to explore Singapore through "reading trails". It is also a lovely way to get to know some local writers.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!

events.name: Investment Trends in Southeast Asia -- How Investors Look at the Region? by @Justin Hall
events.description:
This session is intended to help attendees understand how investors look at potential investments and close deals. It'll not only cover broad investment trends in Singapore and Southeast Asia, but will also help entrepreneurs understand such complex issues like determining when to raise, understanding key terms on a term sheet, and how to pitch to investors. 

Justin Hall is Principal at Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Singapore but investing across Southeast Asia, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. 

As principal, he manages Golden Gate Ventures' existing portfolio while sourcing investments across APAC. In addition, he is director for Golden Gate Ventures Annex Fund, focused on follow-on funding for existing portfolio companies.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR ATTENDEES:

* Lunch is sponsored by Golden Gate Ventures for this Hackers & Painters session

* Venue sponsor: NUS Enterprise as usual! :-)

* NUS Enterprise/Plugin has moved to #02-09, so look for the new space right by the stair case on Level 2, Blk 71!  Do not go to the old location at #02-18

See you!

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (September)
events.description: Following up from our previous session in August, we have planned another fun-filled Ruby on Rails workshop for you all this month! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts! Come and join us at the September Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15 Registration • 10:15 - 10:20 Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30 Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00 Start to code  ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Ted - Sherwyn - Lincoln Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).

events.name: DSSG Sep Meetup - Garuda Robotics
events.description: *Please note that RSVP will only start on Sunday (17 Sep, 2015), 12:00pm.*  Garuda Robotics builds drone systems and use them to capture data and generate actionable insights. For this meetup, they will share about using drone captured photos for computer vision. Synopsis: What exactly goes on in the commercial drone/UAV industry in Singapore and globally? Behind the hype of consumer “selfie” drones lies a vast number of interesting commercial applications, where drones become an enabler for enterprises to gain new aerial perspectives of their facilities and estates, to make intelligent decisions incorporating this additional dimension of data.In this presentation, we will look at one such drones-at-work application to reveal some of the behind-the-scene processes and technologies employed. Specifically, we will dive into the precision agriculture domain and share some of the computer vision problems we face, and take a look at various potential solutions to these challenges. Agenda: • 7.00pm - 7.15pm: Networking • 7.15pm - 8.15pm: Garuda Robotics (TBC) • 8.15pm - 8.30pm: Closing and Networking Speaker: Jiin Joo Ong is co-founder, and CTO, of a Singapore-based robotics startup, Garuda Robotics. He has a diverse background consisting of 12 years in software development, technology scouting, business development, government service, and telecommunications. I read Computer Science in Carnegie Mellon University (BS CS + Econs 2003) and Stanford University (MS CS 2004).
events.location: SMU School of Economics and Social Science, Seminar Room 5.2 (lift access only), 90 Stamford Road, Singapore

Paper #2: Zippier ZMap: Internet-Wide Scanning at 10 Gbps - Lukas Dunphy - https://www.usenix.org/system/files/conference/woot14/woot14-adrian.pdf

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

events.name: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy Advanced Features - A Demo
events.description: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) is an integrated penetration testing tool for finding vulnerabilities in web applications. Over the past few years, it has significantly grown its popularity, features and contributions from WW engineers, as it comes straight out of the OWASP community, absolutely free of cost and most of all, easy to use! This demo-based training session covers the basics and advanced features of ZAP, which will enable application developers to understand and automate the tool usage, application testers to perform security tests and security engineers to provide consultation on best-practices of using the tool. Speaker:Viswanath S Chirravuri has over 10 years of experience in IT Security space. Currently he is a Software Security Architect for Asia region at a leading digital security company, GEMALTO. He actively holds industry certifications like CISSP, CEH, GWAPT, Security+, PMP and SCJP. Viswanath is accredited by CA Technologies on Identity and Access management suite of products. Over the past 3 years, he has been giving training's on various SAST and DAST tools to application security engineers in financial services and telecommunications industries. NOTE:1. You will need to sign in at ground floor security counter of One Raffles Place Tower 2.2. Akamai will provide a brief update on their view of the threat landscape, and security portfolio.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616

"5 Random Ruby Tips" - Huiming @teohm  * Hot Picks- This is a 5-10 minutes session during which anyone canstand up and say something interesting!  -------------- Would you like to speak at our future meetups? You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! We also have a 5min section on "5 Random Ruby Tips"that you can volunteer for - I am sure you must havecame across some interesting Ruby nuggets in thelast month right? So don't be shy! Step forward and share your knowledge! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com,or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com, or Guo Xiang @tgx_world or tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? Do you have a job posting?Email us a blurb (< 50 words) + link and we'll put it here. -------------- Thank You, Sponsors! Food and Drinks:   Venue:

events.name: Gaining Insights Into the Tech Industry
events.description:
<A 2-Hour Info Session on the World of Developers> PLEASE REGISTER HERE>>> With technology progressing so rapidly, programmers are much sought after by companies globally. Coding is now THE SKILL to have. It doesn't matter if you are looking to work in a tech company or build your own start-up, you will needing this very special set of skills.  So if you're still thinking whether there's a place for you in the tech/software industry, wait no more...  Come and hear what our industry expert has to say! Get ready to dive into the world of developers.   Ticket Fees: Early Bird: $15 (Valid till 16 September 2015)Regular: $29Currently only 20 seats left! PLEASE REGISTER HERE>>>  < WHO SHOULD JOIN > Anyone who has the passion, who wants to know more about tech industry and landscape on a local and global scale. This info session is ideal for beginners who are curious, and perhaps aspire to enter the world of coding - either as an employee or business owner, full-time or part-time career. 


< WHAT YOU WILL LEARN > • A day in the life of a coder  • Most sought-after languages/frameworks in the industry • Career development of a developer, salary and demand statistics  • Soft skills: Pair programming, scrumming, project management  • The shortcut to entering the industry  • And get all your questions answered  


SEE YOU THERE!
events.location: Auston Institute of Management, 50 Ophir Road, #02-00, Singapore

events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
anGie Seah, with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic
Thursday 8 October, 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Inspired by the phrase ‘Butterflies in the stomach’, anGie Seah attempts to present the physical spectacle of our hearts and guts manifesting such sensations. In a mash up of unpredictable drumming, piano tapping, bass droning, erratic voice-works combined with everyday sounds, anGie together with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic reinterpret emotions and ideas that spoken words fail to evoke. Where words and emotions share no common ground, this immense audio-visual experience will trigger your senses through the orchestra of sounds, actions and imagery. Get ready to open your hearts and minds at this live performance not to be missed.

In partnership with the NTU CCA Singapore Residencies Programme.

events.name: Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
events.description:
Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
17-18 Oct, Sat to Sun, 10am to 6pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

As part of Sunday Showcase, The Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab presents imaginative ways to engage the public in envisioning the future of technology and a Smart Nation. An invited group of participants across art, design and technology will work together to imagine what the future for a Smart Nation could entail. Involving narrative scenarios, critical thinking, participatory art and rapid prototyping, this showcase will aim to produce unique, creative perspectives on the developing landscape evolving around new technology. 

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
events.description:
FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
Saturday 17 October
10.15am -7.30pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is a smart nation, and what does it mean to be a smart citizen? How are artists, designers, futurists and civic innovators playing with the technology that is weaving itself into the fabric of our cities, economies and infrastructure? In partnership with ArtScience Museum, FutureEverything’s first ground-breaking conference in Singapore will look at how life, work and play have been fundamentally transformed by technology, and will form part of a national conversation in Singapore on the place of smart technology in society and culture. Noted speakers include critical futurist Scott Smith, designer and Internet of Things expert Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino, technology critic and fellow of Harvard’s Berkman Institute Sara Watson, lead strategist for globalfutures agenda Cheryl Chung, Nanyang Technical Institutes’ Andrea Nanetti, and the team behind Hello Lamppost, PAN Studios.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!
